summary:
Please
Jonsa fans never restrain yourselves from posting in the Jon snow, Game of
thrones or GOT  tag.  It doesn’t matter what...
body:
Please Jonsa fans never restrain yourselves from posting in the Jon snow, Game of thrones or GOT  tag. 

It doesn’t matter what the antis say, those tags ARE NOT exclusive to any ship.

I actually never  post Jonsa stuff on any of them, but in the light of recent events I’m going to start doing it. Just to piss out a bitter b*tch.

blog.name: onedizzyprincess

blog.description: Disabled and confused. Hufflepunk.

summary: My GoT's predictions for S8 * Spoiler alert *
body:
My GoT’s predictions for S8 * Spoiler alert *

Predictions:

  • Sansa being pissed @ Jon for bending the knee, dividing the siblings on issues once again & thus there being extreme beef between her & Dany

●○

  • This is a given but the extreme awkwardness that ensues when Jon & Daenerys when they find out about R+L= J aka they’re Aunt & nephew

●○

  • The rest of the Lords in the north try or do put Sansa as *Queen in the North* when they find out Jon’s bent the knee

●○

  • Jaime is the one to kill Cersei

Or

  • Cersei is the one who kills Jamie whilst Lady Brienne runs to the rescue but is a second to late then drives Oathkeeper through an unsuspecting Cersei

●○

  • Leaving Lord Tyrion as the last of the Lannisters & Lord of Casterly Rock

Now this one is not likely I think but …..

  • Cersei kills herself when she realizes she is defeated….unlikely just a headcanon.

●○

  • Jon or Daenerys dies or both

Okay lemme explain.

If Jon dies & Daenerys is pregnant then that would leave a Targaryen heir & a Targaryen on the Iron throne & no one to contest Sansa as Lady of Winterfell a legitimate Stark as Warden in the North. Leaving it the way the it was all those years ago with a Targaryen on the Iron throne & a Stark as Warden in the North right back where we started coming full circle.

Okay why I think Jon snow won’t die.

  • It wouldn’t make much sense to me in a writer’s sense becuz he’s already died leaving us all on a giant cliff hanger he was the biggest death by far the most grieved & they brought him back. I doubt that he would be brought back to defeat the Night King & then just die again…..

Both die

  • Okay so if they both die then that would leave Gendry as the sole heir to the Iron throne. Most likely wedding Sansa the eldest daughter & most capable of the Starks politically anyway to rule &
  • ( listen I ship Gendry & Arya ok it pains me say this) as the Queen to a Baratheon on the throne.

Making Robert Baratheon wanting to join houses in season one come true…..

  • Also this would put Bran as Lord of Winterfell & Arya as his person to do his bidding in the Times he couldn’t.

If Daenerys dies

  • Thus leaving Jon a Targaryen on the Iron throne & I haven’t thought or can’t seem to figure who he’d marry or if he would by the end of the show. But he would also I believe have the at least one dragon & He would ride it as a Targaryen should. & this would leave Sansa as Lady of Winterfell & warden of the North.

●○

  • Those are all I got rn tell me urs if you’ve got any

blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: I always have a couple of things to say about my fav asoiaf relationship
summary: If you believe that Jon is going to be disgusted by/disappointed in Arya when they will reunite, then you don’t understand his...
body:
If you believe that Jon is going to be disgusted by/disappointed in Arya when they will reunite, then you don’t understand his character at all.

Jon Snow treasures Arya more than life itself. There is no way he’s going to be anything less than ecstatic to be reunited with his beloved little sister.

And while we are at it, if you think that Jon loves any of his siblings more than Arya then you also don’t understand his character at all.

And while we are at it, if you think that Jon loves any of his siblings more than Arya then you also don’t understand his character at all.

And while we are at it, if you think that Jon loves any of his siblings more than Arya then you also don’t understand his character at all.

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

summary:
Fan Fiction
I’m thinking of trying my hand at some Jonerys fanfic - little vignettes and what nots, missing moments, across the...
body:
Fan Fiction

I’m thinking of trying my hand at some Jonerys fanfic - little vignettes and what nots, missing moments, across the fluffy - horny continuum. I haven’t written a fan fic in YEARS, and never in the ASOIAF-verse. I have actually only read a portion of book 1, but the show is my jam, and it would be in my voice, not GRRM’s. I’ve found so many juicy ones while I’ve been here and I’m inspired. I have no plot bunny because I have no time or energy for a full-fledged work.But I always have time for lusty dragon sex. Stay tuned.

Also, I’ve read several Jonerys smut works in the last few months and I have to give kudos for never once reading the word “undulating.” It’s sex, not yoga. (Sorry, just a pet peeve-y word for me!)

CAUTION⚠️⚠️⚠️⚠️

Jon Snow thrusting ahead.

Srsly. That thrust. A signature move. Well done, Aegon, sir.

blog.name: kellyvela
blog.title: IF I CAN DREAM…
blog.description: Waiting for The Winds of Winter to read the real Jon Snow written by GRRM

summary: It feels incongruous to see him like this, in non-Jon Snow form, wearing civilian clothes as opposed to dense swaths of fur and,...
body:
It feels incongruous to see him like this, in non-Jon Snow form, wearing civilian clothes as opposed to dense swaths of fur and, occasionally, smiling, free of the residual existential trauma associated with having been stabbed to death (fucking Olly!) and then brought back to life by way of some extremely dark magic.

Emotional baggage isn’t the only one of Jon Snow’s signature traits that Harington is without right now: He also does not wear his hair in a bun, which has become the Warden of the North’s go-to look post-resurrection. 

“They wanted me to look more like Ned Stark,” Harington tells me, when I ask him about Snow’s sudden preference for the updo. 

And with that, the actor confirms that prevailing theory about this hair switch-up: The Jon who wrenches Winterfell from the hands of House Bolton in the bloodiest battle the North has ever seen is just not the same Lord Commander who brooded it up as top bastard in the Night’s Watch. Now, he’s renewed his Stark card, just in time for audiences to find out that, um, he actually isn’t the tragic patriarch’s bastard son after all. 

“There’s a real reason behind [my hairstyle],” he says, “to show how the story was evolving.”

Source

blog.name: princessmissandei
blog.title: Night Wolf
blog.description: Marie | Slytherin | Writer About and Before You Follow Multi-fandom blog with an emphasis on ASOIAF and various period dramas. Very fond of canon Starks, Targaryens, Durrandons and Baratheons. Reylos do not engage.

tags: jon is channeling fitzgerald for this one
i have had enough ok lol
summary:
Jon Snow to Daenerys Haters:
No personality as strong as Daenerys’ could go without getting hate and as you say she is not above...
body:
Jon Snow to Daenerys Haters:

No personality as strong as Daenerys’ could go without getting hate and as you say she is not above reproach. I’ve always known that. Any woman who has confidence and takes pride in who she is, who earns and wields power in her own right, who fights against injustice even when it’s the cultural norm, who owns her sexuality and doesn’t apologize for it, can expect to be criticized in this hypocritical world we live in.

But, Haters, I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity and her flaming self respect and it’s these things I’d believe in even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn’t all that she should be.

But of course the real reason we’re together in the TV adaptation and will be the main pairing of the novel series, as well, is that I love her and that’s the beginning and end of everything. You’re still insisting I’m conning her, as if I would even consider doing something like that, but Daenerys is the only queen I intend to bend my knee to. So stay basic and deal with it. 

Sincerely, 

Jon Snow

tags: SO EVERYONE LIVES ON DRAGONSTONE UNBOTHERED
summary: How long ago did the Targaryens foresee the coming of the Long Night? Brandon the builder seemed sure it would come again, so...
body:
How long ago did the Targaryens foresee the coming of the Long Night? Brandon the builder seemed sure it would come again, so the Starks and the first men enslaved giants into building the wall. Aegon the conqueror was determined to unite the Seven Kingdoms, but was it only for lust of power? 

Valyrian Steel and obsidian can kill the others, and while the Targaryens had no connection to the long night, they were Valyrians, and they did immigrate to the very island that harbors mountains of dragonglass. There is the dragons themselves, of course. 

I’m not a fan of what came to be of the Targaryen Dynasty. Whatever else Robert might be, his rebellion was needed to overthrow an oppressive rule through a feudalistic King who failed to protect his people, and an heir who turned a blind eye to it. 

The initial “keeping the bloodlines” was for what? Racism against the Westerosi, or to protect the “dragon-rider” bonds?

If by any chance there is ever a Targaryen restoration of any sort, I would absolutely abhor for them to continue any practice of nuclear-family incest, preferably ending the extended-family incest with Jon and Dany. 

If a Targaryen restoration means restoring the nuclear-incest, with dragon-rider men and women that will just continue the cycle of the “Game of Thrones”, then I don’t want it. Keep it. Give me a happy and safe family. At the very least, a fair ruler in a Mornarchy of seven Kingdoms, but the dream would be that every Kingdom could find its own rule. No more Iron throne, and no more games.

The winter, the dragons, the others, they didn’t come to put this king or that king on the throne, they came to wake up humanity and show them the true fight.

summary: Kit Harington Confirms Our Theory About Jon Snow's Post-Resurrection Hair
body:
Kit Harington Confirms Our Theory About Jon Snow’s Post-Resurrection Hair

Where’s all the metas about Jon Snow and Sansa Stark resembling Ned and Catelyn? Cuz you guys we’re on the money!!! Read it and weep haters! Lol!

“They wanted me to look more like Ned Stark,” Harington tells me, when I ask him about Snow’s sudden preference for the updo.

summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Wedding Day 6 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/4iAjv5dSmQ   Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Wedding Day 6 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/4iAjv5dSmQ 

 Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: Jonerys Appreciation Week: Day 05 -Tropes A hero (masculine) or heroine (feminine) is someone who demonstrates bravery,...
caption:
Jonerys Appreciation Week: Day 05 -Tropes

A hero (masculine) or heroine (feminine) is someone who demonstrates bravery, strength, and perseverance in the face of adversity; someone who feels a moral obligation to make the world a better place; someone who is willing to sacrifice his or her life for something bigger than oneself.

reblog.comment:
Jonerys Appreciation Week: Day 05 -Tropes

A hero (masculine) or heroine (feminine) is someone who demonstrates bravery, strength, and perseverance in the face of adversity; someone who feels a moral obligation to make the world a better place; someone who is willing to sacrifice his or her life for something bigger than oneself.
